bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, December 22, 1928

div1.p: Russell states that he has enjoyed Carter's weekly letters about her progress and thanks Carter and Brown for their efforts.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, December 22, 1928
div1.opener:
Book, Misel
Report (weekly)
SELSKAR M. GUNN, VICE PRESIDENT
IN EUROPE
ROGER S. GREENE, VICE PRESIDENT
IN FAR EAST
---
ASSOCIATE DIRECTORS
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
WILBUR A. SAWYER, M.D.
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES
GEORGE E. VINCENT
PRESIDENT
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH DIVISION
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D., DIRECTOR
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “ROCKFOUND”
NORMA S. THOMPSON, SECRETARY
L. G. MYERS, TREASURER
GEORGE J. BEAL, COMPTROLLER
---
TRUSTEES DIVISIONAL COMMITTEE
THE PRESIDENT
SIMON FLEXNER
VERNON KELLOGG
WILLIAM ALLEN WHITE
December 22, 1928
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
From week to week I have derived great pleasure
and satisfaction from reading of your progress in the work.
It is very gratifying to know it is nearing completion, not
only for the work itself but because it will give you an
opportunity to rest for a while and get back in good physical
condition. I hope you will join the rest of us in taking
time off during the Christmas holidays. I hope to see
Dr. Frost early in the New Year and to learn something of
his plans for completing the work.

With best wishes and many thanks to both you and
Miss Brown, I am
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell Miss L. A. Carter
The Westmoreland
2122 California Street NW
Washington, D.C.
FFR:R:DH
